definition: different mouths, same voice/to speak in unison (idiom)
different/other/hetero-/unusual/strange/surprising/to distinguish/to separate/to discriminate
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
like/same/similar/together/alike/with
sound/voice/tone/noise/reputation/classifier for sounds

sentences.english: The resolution was acclaimed with one voice.
sentences.chinese: 決議博得滿場異口同聲的歡呼。

sentences.english: Everybody spoke in praise of her devotion to the cause of education.
sentences.chinese: 大家異口同聲地稱讚她獻身教育事業的精神。

sentences.english: The teachers praised him with one accord.
sentences.chinese: 老師們異口同聲地稱讚他。

sentences.english: "The world's scientists have spoken clearly, and with one voice," he said.
sentences.chinese: “全世界的科學家已明確發表意見，異口同聲”他說。

sentences.english: crowds in Tehran chorused that Israel had been “destroyed”.
sentences.chinese: 德黑蘭也異口同聲的認爲以色列已被“破壞”。

sentences.english: "I'll buy your donkey, " said the two.
sentences.chinese: “我想要買你的驢子，”兩人異口同聲說。

sentences.english: The papers all chorused the praise of the president.
sentences.chinese: 各報異口同聲地對總統進行頌揚。

sentences.english: The papers all chorused the praises of the President.
sentences.chinese: 異口同聲地對總統表示讚揚。

sentences.english: The children agreed that this was a clever plan.
sentences.chinese: 孩子們都異口同聲的說這是一個聰明的計劃。

definition: meaningful and heartfelt words (idiom); sincere and earnest wishes
to become exhilarated (idiom); in high spirits/full of zest
to agree by chance (idiom); taking the same action without prior consultation
to glare like a tiger watching his prey (idiom)/to eye covetously
to sigh with regret/lament
brimming with enthusiasm (idiom); full of warmth
to return from a rewarding journey
to inquire into/to ask after
to rack one's brains
ambition/ambitious
sales representative/salesperson
to be surprised/to be astonished
not to accept as correct (idiom); to object/to disapprove/to take exception to
to be eager to give sth a try (idiom)
to discuss spiritedly (idiom)/tongues are wagging
to volunteer for/to offer to undertake
